title: Syracuse University Founded
description: After a Feb. 1870 resolution is signed at the Methodist State Convention to establish a university in Syracuse, the first Board of Trustees officially sign the University charter and certificate of incorporation. The Board is led by Rev. Jesse T. Peck, who helped raise the $500,000 ($9.1 million in 2014 dollars) necessary to incorporate.

title: First Class Admitted
description: The first Syracuse University class of 41 students (7 women, 34 men) start attending classes. Students can enroll in a 4-year program of classical study, or a 3-year program of scientific study. Classes are held downtown at the Myers' Block while the Hall of Languages is still under construction.
